Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: To deliver, through excellent leadership and engagement with CPS staff and partners in the Criminal Justice System, the highest quality, most efficient and effective prosecution service within their Area, across all legal advice, legal decisions, advocacy, business and staff management.  To promote CPS’ core values and the equality and diversity agenda, ensuring there are effective internal and external communications strategies in place.  They will work collaboratively and collegiately in their Area to deliver improvements in local and the wider Area performance, ensuring consistent and clear high quality representation of CPS across the wide range of the Area’s responsibilities and relationships.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: Plays a key role in maximising efficiencies across the CPS on both casework and support service issues; is directly accountable to the Director of Public Prosecutions for the quality of legal decisions and for the delivery of performance and business outcomes.  Within the context of the CPS strategic objectives, they are accountable for setting business direction, priorities and coordinating all the Areas within their remit to ensure that performance against all targets is met.  Responsible for the Area Complex Casework Unit and direct management responsibility for the Deputy Chief Crown Prosecutors/Deputy Heads of Division within their Area/Division.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The job holder will lead on delivering and maximising efficiencies through digital working and will also serve as the principal liaison with Her Majesty’s Courts and Tribunals Service (HMCTS) joint project on developing a common CPS/HMCTS IT (Information Technology) platform. They will provide strategic direction and leadership across the CPS and in partnership with HMCTS, to develop a sustainable cost effective and efficient solution to meet the information management and business process needs of both agencies.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: The Senior Legal Advisor reports directly to the DPP providing advice and assistance on the most complex, sensitive and high profile casework and assurance on legal standards across the CPS.  This includes provision of strategic direction, setting case strategies, dealing with complex disclosure matters, media handling and trial strategies, working with and directing the reviewing prosecutor/Counsel.  As the Head of Profession for the organisation (besides the DPP) they also lead a group of CPS advocates and conduct certain appellate advocacy on behalf of the service.

Name: Saunders
Job/Team Function: The Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) is the national head of service for the Crown Prosecution Service for England and Wales, appointed by and responsible to the Attorney General.  It is the function of the DPP with a view to initiation or continuation of criminal proceedings, to consider the facts and information brought to their notice by police or others, and where they think proper, to initiate, undertake and carry on criminal proceedings.

Name: Folland
Job/Team Function: The Chief Executive is responsible for running the organisation on a day-to-day basis and to implement the strategic goals and objectives of the CPS.  Working closely with the DPP, they enable the CPS Board to fulfil its governance function. They are also responsible for overseeing human resource management, financial issues, community and public relations.  They provide direction and leadership towards the achievement of the CPS’ philosophy, mission statement, strategy and its annual goals and objectives.

Name: N/D
Job/Team Function: This role covers a range of core functions from complex casework to policy to people management.  The job holder will work in partnership with a wide range of experts to achieve CPS’ goals.  They influence the CPS business model,  and are adept at communicating it to internal and external audiences.  They provide assurance to the CPS Board on the achievement of the highest standards of internal controls and public sector governance. They are able to develop team capability in line with the business plan and organisational vision and to manage change effectively, identifying resistance, building engagement, involvement, and recognising and rewarding innovation. They take responsibilility for the successful delivery of programme benefits through cost effective measurement processes and oversee the development and delivery of viable business cases.

They are able to develop team capability in line with the business plan and organisational vision and to manage change effectively, identifying resistance, building engagement, involvement, and recognising and rewarding innovation. They take responsibilility for the successful delivery of programme benefits through cost effective measurement processes and oversee the development and delivery of viable business cases.
